title.narrative: Restudy of the local power structure

description.narrative:
Detta är en återstudie av den lokala maktanalysen som gjordes 2004. Huvudsyftet med studien är att identifiera, analysera och beskriva formella och informella politiska, sociala och ekonomiska drivkrafter till förändring i jämförelse med den ursprungliga studien. Ett särskilt fokus läggs på att integrera ett genderperspektiv genom hela studien. Vidare kommer studien också att inkludera ett urbant perspektiv för att bättre reflektera den nya resultatstrategin för Bangladesh. Studien kommer också att bidra till ambassadens förståelse och tillämpning av ett konfliktperspektiv.
Studien kommer att genomföras av samma forskare och konsulter som gjorde den ursprungliga studien 2004.

This is a restudy of the local power analysis done in 2004. The main objective is to identify, analyse and describe formal and informal political, social and economic drivers of change in comparison with the original study. A particular focus is placed on the integration of a gender perspective throughout the study.

participating-org.narrative: University, college or other teaching institution, research institute or think-tank

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
As per the agreement, Contracted Research Firm has produced three results, which are as follow:
Publication: The main output from the restudy was the published book entitled Revisiting the Local Power Structure in Bangladesh: Economic Gain, Political Pain? by David Lewis and Abul Hossain published in September 2017 (ISBN: 978-1-909890-40-4, pp.130). The book was printed by The Shikka Bichitra printers in Dhaka and typeset by the LSE Design Unit, following the format is designed to resemble the earlier study published in 2008 as a Sida Study.
Press Release: The contracting research agency has also produced a Press Release that was used to publicize the study findings in Bangladesh.
Workshops: Three workshops were held; one was Field training workshop (15 December 2015) to provide an overview of the ToR and the research design to the field team, who also contributed to the planning of the study. It included discussion of research ethics and put in place arrangements for informed consent for all interviews and focus groups. The second one was the Feedback workshop (20 May, 2017) which was held in Faridpur to share and validate the preliminary findings gathered from the study locations and the third workshop was the national launching workshop (25 October 2017) where the key findings were shared and discussed with key experts and agencies working on the local government and governance issues in Bangladesh.
So in summary, the Power Restudy contract has achieved it’s targeted results successfully.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
